column5: Wow what a great job you guys have done here. I'm sure Sonny would be amazed by the generosity you guys have shown. I was looking through my photos from last Januarys Ice fishing seminar that was held at Fishingworld here in Hamilton. I found this photo I took of Big Jim and Sonny's young boy Domenic , who would have known what the future was to hold, I hope Big Jim gets to see this photo. l Just put the check in the mail tonight T.J. . You have done an incredible job here.
Ill make sure he see it, thanks.

I called my sister in law - Jennifer last night to let her know the amazing support and generosity that has come from OFC and she was beyond words... THANK YOU so very very much on behalf of Sonny and his Family!  You all are amazing, not only in these moments but during the everyday!  Thanks TJ for setting this all up! Kudos Bernadette (jen) and My Whole Family

This one is very close to home. My father died suddenly at the age of 42 when I was 2 and he also loved fishing.  I can relate to those kids growing up without a Father.  $100 coming your way TJ.  OFNers prove once again what a CLASS ACT they are!!!! And Mr. Mercer you never cease to amaze me.  Kudos to you my friend.  Although I never fished with Sonny, I met him many times and found him to be a such a likeable guy. Rest in peace Sonny.

Tj I will have the wife send a check out this weekend also The OFC family has always come through for its members I guess that is why so many great friend's have found each other on this site if it were not for this site I would not know half of the people I fish with. I hope for the best in the future for his kids.  Merry Christmas
So good deeds do mature!!!   Just got off the phone with the scholarship people and indeed the first set of funds will be available next year..   A long time coming but good work!
T.J. Quesnel P.O. Box 6264 Sturgeon Falls, ON  P2B 3K7   Thanks Bennetts!!
Yes thanks Bennetts!!!  Hey were getting there!!!
Another $100 anonymous from a LONG Time member!!
I suspect that you'll be ponying up Mr. Mercer. Kudos to you and all the wonderful members for stepping up to the plate.  Awesome.
Another $20!!!!
Another $100 from a facebook friend of mine, Thanks Barry and Lydia!!  merry xmas to you!
Were getting close!!!!!  $1450!!!  Come on!! We can do it!
PM sent TJ...
Awesome!!  Thanks John...   were really close now!!

JP DeRose is putting in a great $200 donation.. to put us way OVER the TOP!!!!!!   Something tells me he wants to see Dave write the cheque!!  $1,750 all together.  But there's no need to stop here!!!  Every penny will go to the kids!!  Thank you to all who contributed and thanks Dave!!!!  I feel like a million bucks today!!!
Sweet!!
The spirit of our community never fails to impress me. Well done everyone.
You are a good man TJ!!  Kudos to OFC for proving once again that C mean community!
Congrat's guys and gals, there was never any doubt. Keep those cheques coming.......
Was there ever any doubt that we'd reach our goal ??  This board always comes thru when one of our own needs a boost.  Well done everyone !!!!
Best news I have heard all day.  SWEET.
$50 from my wife Sam and I sent via Paypal.  Let's keep it coming!
Awesome!!
You guys are all Awesome! Way to go lets keep the money coming in and raise as much as possible.  TJ our cheque for $1600 is on the way  Dave Mercer
Thanks Dave...  we can always count on you for your generosity and heart...  your the reel deel!!

Glad to help out TJ, you're a good man for doing stuff like this (despite what others might say  )  Huge kudos to Dave Mercer and all the OFC members for once again proving that when it comes to generosity you guys and gals are in a class of your own!  JP
The Collective is generous.
We did good today, its not over yet, Im still accepting donations till the 18th!!  Im gonna pin this till then.
Patsy and I just happen to have a little CN money left over from this year.   I'll be dropping another $40.00 in the mail tomorrow.   Sure hope it gets to you in time.
Thanks!! Im sure it will!

A while back we learned about the passing of Sonny (Santo). Santo was only 40 when he passed away, and being only a bit older, its given me much pause to think. In the spirit of Xmas, I've decided to do a quick little fundraiser here to gather up some cash to set up a RESP (Registered Education Savings Plan) for each of the kids, Domenic and Emma. (3 and 6 years old). All money raised will be put into individual RESP units with USC EDUCATION SAVINGS PLANS INC. (http://www.usc.ca) USC has been doing my plans for Avery and Jaden since they were born, and I know our representative well. I've spoken to him and in order to get a full unit for each child we need about $1,600.00, if we surpass that the size of the units just go up, but that's our minimum. These are a great STABLE way to save for the kids education, as the government also matches a portion of the contributions. I'm not an expert on all the ins and outs, so if there's any questions please visit the website. My USC rep. is going to be here in town on December 18th so I would have the cheques mailed to me, made payable to me so I can deposit them. Ill have a list of all donations easily available when we are done, so you can be sure all funds will be accounted for. Any donations - of ANY size - will be appreciated and can be mailed to me at: T.J. Quesnel P.O. Box 6264 Sturgeon Falls, ON P2B 3K7  You can pledge your money here, or if you want to remain anonymous just pm me so I can keep track of how much we raise. Lets show Sonnys family, how much this community, once again, cares about its members. It's the season for giving, and the most selfless gift is to someone who will never know where it came from.  I'm in for the first $100.00, please help me out with whatever you can. SO far:  $100.00 $40.00 $100.00 $250.00 $100.00 $100.00 $20.00 $100.00 $100.00 $50.00 $30.00 $50.00 $100.00 $40.00 $50.00 $100.00 $20.00 $100.00 $100.00 $200.00 $50  $1800 Total Pledged.

That's a great idea TJ, just one other thought. Is there any way we could open a bank account, which would allow us to just make a deposit. We could post the account number, transit number and bank number and folks could easily stop off at a branch, local to them and make a donation. I don't want to make this any more complicated than it is, but thought this may be another way to get some money to the kids. HH
Sure thing, if you would like to do it that way, pm me and ill give you the info!!
Could call HH.  I never met the man,but the kids need some help here.After all,christmas is for the kids.
$40 from an anonymous donor... thanks!!  Any amount will help.
I'm in for $100 and will get the cheque out to you in the morning TJ
Up we go.  It,s christmas all.
Another anonymous donor..  for $250, very generous and much appreciated.  Pledge what ya can.
$100.00 is on its way to you soon as I get it in the mailbox tomorrow morning.  I put in the memo area........c/o "Sonny"(Santo)
Thanks!!

OK guys it's the festive season and this is a family that really could use a little Christmas cheer. So here is my offer or challege to you all. We need $1600 to get RESP's for each of the kids. But the more the better! So Facts of Fishing will match the first $1600 if the OFC'ers get there by 4pm tomorrow. So please everyone - do your part and support this great cause. If we can make it to $1600 by 4pm tomorrow we will add another $1600.  Dave Mercer
HOLY MOLY!!!  Thanks Dave, thats fantastic!!  Come on everyone...  we need the dough now, even small donations can make the difference!!!!
$20 from an anonymous donor... come on folks   help me out.  Lets make Dave pony up!!!

A huge thanks from all of Sonny's family...  As I said to TJ earlier today when he called to ask me if this would be ok... Sonny left his family well taken care of.  It has been a shock to us all as we never expected anything to happen to a man of 40. Many people asked us what they could do... and wow, this one is huge... Domenic and Emma have a long road ahead of them but a family that loves them very much... from them and Sonny's wife Jennifer... Thankyou for making that road a little smother.  There was a video made of him that was played... I don't know how to include it here but if you go to our cousins blog you will be able to see it and him in many of his fishing moments...  http://markleslie.blogspot.com/2009/11/hnt-sonny.html  Santo loved to fish, OFC was a part of his everyday, from checking out who was fishing where to bragging about what he caught or didn't catch... Time and time again I am amazed by all of you...  Thank you so much  Bernadette (Jen)
I'll be sending you $100, TJ.
Thats great Rick!!  Were 1/2 way there!!!
$40 more from an anonymous donor!!

Jen, Steve, and Family.  Be strong. I can't make it to the fundraiser, but i'll keep his memory with me at Quinte.  However, please accept $100 on my families behalf.  We fisherman must stick together.  Sonny, my friend, Rest in Peace.  Dave, amazing offer. TV show or not, your a Class Act.
Bly and I talked about it and we can scrape together $50 to donate....  TJ...you will have it this morning in your paypal account.
Thanks Cliff AND another $30 from an anon.   Thanks everyone, were getting there!!
Big Jim McLaughlin just threw in $100, Thanks Big Jim!!
Hope you are feeling well, Jim!
Another $40 from a good friend of mine!!! next beers on me bud!!!  you know who you are... lol..  what was that quote... "good stories always start with bad decisions."
I just got handed a cheque from Benetts towing here in Hamilton for $50.00 , just let me know where to send it and who do I write it out to ?
